result.execSummary:
The defendant James R. Fairbanks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James R. Fairbanks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James R. Fairbanks was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $568 fine.    Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

judgments.dispoDesc: State moves to amend Ct #2 to straight disorderly conduct, striking domestic enhancer.  Court approves.  DEF pleads No Contest.  Found Guilty.  Sentence $768 fine/costs, including DNA surcharge.    Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.  DEF ordered to provide DNA sample at jail immediately after court  today.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James R. Fairbanks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James R. Fairbanks in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEF is making voluntary appearance.  Court quashes warrant.  No bond forfeiture.   Parties have reached agreement.   DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  State moves to amend Ct #2 to straight disorderly conduct, striking domestic enhancer.  Court approves.  DEF pleads No Contest.  Found Guilty.  Sentence $768 fine/costs, including DNA surcharge.    Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.  DEF ordered to provide DNA sample at jail immediately after court today.
Count #1 dismissed.

Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court  Poquette, Bruce appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests warrant and forfeiture proceedings.  Court warrant to be ordered and bail forfeiture proceedings to begin

Court advised the defendnat to contact the public defender today.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
